instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 turns on no brain?
threads.message:
Liquid damaged keyboard connector and around UA600.
I replaced a few caps that looked damaged (C7274, C7290, CA607) and retinned the keyboard connector.
I also reflowed UA600 to make sure that all pins are properly connected. 

The device turns on, takes 19.2V and 1.13A.
The fans start at normal speed and after a minute go high speed.
There is no activity on USB hdd.
The trackpad clicks.
No image, no keyboard backlight nor capslock light.

Both the CPU and the GPU gets hot.

PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0.690V
PPVCORE_S0_GPU - 0.902V

threads.title: 820-00928 turns on no brain?
threads.message:
Something else affected by corrosion; maybe bad CPU now.

Try known good working BIOS, just in case.
